title: Ficus benghalensis
Parts of plant used: Bark, root-fibers, leaves, seeds, milky juice (i.e. latex)
Chemical Constituents: Riterpin, Friedelin, Beta sitostero, glucoside, flavonoid glycosides, Leucocyanidin and Leucopelargonidin.
Therapeutic uses: It is astringent to bowels; useful in treatment of biliousness, ulcers, erysipelas, vomiting, vaginal complains, fever, inflammations, leprosy.
